newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - May 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - May 12.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - David Lee, deputy director-general of cabinet's Government Information Office, may be promoted to director-general in planned cabinet reshuffle.
Actress Pai Ping-ping bids final farewell to murdered daughter Pai Hsiao-yen in funeral.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Taiwan to have two five-day work weeks per month starting 1998 (shortened from current six-day weeks).
LIBERTY TIMES - President Lee Teng-hui sets news conference to mark first anniversary of inauguration.
Sources suggest murderers of Pai Hsiao-yen planning to hide in mountains for long time.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Taiwan businesses continue to increase investments in mainland China.
World technology experts hold summit in (Microsoft Corp chairman) Bill Gates' mansion.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Japanese officials hint that yen still has room for appreciation against U.S. dollar.
Will Taiwan stock market see bull run ahead May 20 anniversary of President Lee's inauguration?
